name: Open KBP
short_description: The overall goal of Knowledge Base Population (KBP) is to automatically identify salient and novel entities from multiple languages, link them to corresponding Knowledge Base (KB) entries (if the linkage exists) in a target language, then discover attributes about the entities, and ﬁnally expand the KB with any new attributes. The KBP track at Text Analysis Conference (TAC) consists of two tasks, entity linking (linking an entity mention to an entry in the knowledge base) and slot filling(extract new attributes for an entity). The first open source KBP toolkit is based on the implementation of CUNY BLENDER KBP systems which have achieved high ranks in evaluations of KBP2010 and KBP2011.
summary: source code repository of knowledge base population
